alert.note: Alert for Massac; Pope (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pope, southeastern Massac, Caldwell, Marshall, Trigg, southern Ballard, McCracken, southern Hopkins, Lyon, Fulton, Calloway, southwestern Muhlenberg, central Crittenden, southern Livingston, Christian, Carlisle, Hickman, southwestern Webster, Graves, Mississippi and northeastern New Madrid Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Marion Kentucky to near Brookport Illinois to near Bertrand Missouri. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Marion, Reidland and Lone Oak around 700 PM CDT. Ledbetter around 705 PM CDT. Calvert City and Creswell around 710 PM CDT. Towosahgy State Historic Site and Farmersville around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Princeton, Benton, Olney, Dawson Springs, Clinton, Birmingham Ferry Recreation Area, Hillman Ferry Campground, Demumbers Bay Campground, Cayce, Land Between The Lakes Area, Energy Lake Campground, Woodlands Nature Station and Fulgham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 4 and 79. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 9 and 13. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 111. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 63 and 65. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 45. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 5 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southern Illinois...western, south central and northwestern Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
